And he healed them, [And many companies came nigh to him, having with them dumb men and crooked men, feeble and blind, and many others; and they cast them down at his feet. And he healed them,]

31.verse: so that the people wondered [so that the companies wondered], seeing dumb men speaking, and crooked [men] going, blind men seeing; and they magnified God of Israel.

32.verse: And Jesus, when his disciples were called together, said to them, I have ruth of the people, for they have abided now three days with me, and have nothing to eat; and I will not let them go fasting, lest they fail in the way.

33.verse: And the disciples say to him, Whereof then so many loaves among us in desert, to fulfill so great a people [that we fill so great a company]?

34.verse: And Jesus said to them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven, and a few small fishes.

35.verse: And he commanded the people, to sit to meat on the earth. [And he commanded the company, that they should sit to the meat on the earth.]

36.verse: And he took the seven loaves and five fishes, and did thankings, and brake them, and gave to his disciples; and the disciples gave to the people.

37.verse: And all ate, and were fulfilled, and they took that that was left of remnants, seven baskets full. [And all ate, and were filled, and they took that that was over of the reliefs, seven baskets full.]

38.verse: And they that ate were four thousand of men, without little children and women.

39.verse: And when he had let go the people [And, the company left], he went up into a boat, and came into the coasts of Magdala.

1.verse: And the Pharisees and the Sadducees came to him tempting [And Pharisees and Sadducees tempting him came nigh to him], and prayed him to show them a token from heaven.

2.verse: And he answered, and said to them, When the eventide is come, ye say, It shall be clear, for heaven is ruddy;

3.verse: and the morrowtide, To day tempest [and the morrow, Made to day tempest], for heaven shineth heavily. Then ye know how to deem [wisely] the face of heaven, but ye be not able to know the tokens of times [but ye be not able to know the signs of times].

4.verse: An evil generation and adulterous seeketh a token; and a token shall not be given to it, but the token of Jonas, the prophet. And when he had left them, he went forth [he went away].

5.verse: And when his disciples came over the sea, they forgot to take loaves.

6.verse: And he said to them, Behold ye, and beware of the sourdough of Pharisees and of Sadducees.

7.verse: And they thought among them[selves], and said [saying], For we have not taken loaves.

8.verse: But Jesus witting said to them, What think ye among you of little faith, for ye have not taken loaves?

9.verse: Yet ye understand not, neither have mind of five loaves into five thousand of men, and how many baskets ye took [and how many coffins ye took]?

10.verse: neither of seven loaves into four thousand of men, and how many baskets ye took?

11.verse: Why understand ye not, for I said not to you of bread, Be ye ware of the sourdough of Pharisees and of Sadducees?

12.verse: Then they understood, that he said not to beware of [the] sourdough of loaves, but of the teaching of Pharisees and of Sadducees.

13.verse: And Jesus came into the parts of Caesarea of Philippi, and asked his disciples, and said [saying], Whom say men to be man's Son?

14.verse: And they said, Some John Baptist; others Elias; and others Jeremy, or one of the prophets.

15.verse: Jesus said to them [Jesus saith to them], But whom say ye me to be?

16.verse: Simon Peter answered, and said, Thou art Christ, the Son of God living [Thou art Christ, the Son of quick God].

17.verse: [Forsooth] Jesus answered, and said to him, Blessed art thou, Simon Barjona; for flesh and blood showed not to thee, but my Father that is in heavens.

18.verse: And I say to thee, that thou art Peter, and on this stone I shall build my church, and the gates of hell shall not have power against it. [And I say to thee, for thou art Peter, and upon this stone I shall build my church, and the gates of hell shall not have might, or strength, against it.]

19.verse: And to thee I shall give the keys of the kingdom of heavens; and whatever thou shalt bind on earth, shall be bound also in heavens; and whatever thou shalt unbind on earth, shall be unbound also in heavens.

20.verse: Then he commanded to his disciples, that they should say to no man, that he was Jesus Christ.

21.verse: From that time Jesus began to show to his disciples, that it behooved him to go to Jerusalem, and suffer many things, of the elder men, and of the scribes, and of princes of priests [of the elders, and scribes, and princes of priests]; and be slain, and the third day to rise again.

22.verse: And Peter took him, and began to blame him, and said [saying], Far be it from thee, Lord; this shall not be to thee.

23.verse: And he turned, and said to Peter, Satan, go thou after me; thou art a cause of stumbling to me; for thou savourest not those things that be of God, but those things that be of men. [The which, turned, said to Peter, Satan, go after me; thou art (an) offence to me; for thou savourest not, or understandest not, those things that be of God, but those things that be of men.]

24.verse: Then Jesus said to his disciples, If any man will come after me, deny he himself, and take his cross, and follow me;

25.verse: for he that will make his life safe, shall lose it; and he that shall lose his life for me, shall find it.

26.verse: For what profiteth it to a man [Soothly what profiteth to a man], if he win all the world, and suffer impairing of his soul? or what (ex)changing shall a man give for his soul?

27.verse: For man's Son shall come in the glory of his Father, with his angels, and then he shall yield to every man after his works.

28.verse: Truly I say to you, there be some of them that stand here [there be some of men standing here], which shall not taste death, till they see man's Son coming in his kingdom.

1.verse: And after six days Jesus took Peter, and James, and John, his brother, and led them aside into an high hill,

2.verse: and was transfigured into another likeness before them [and was transfigured, or turned into another likeness, before them]. And his face shone as the sun; and his clothes were made white as snow.

3.verse: And lo! Moses and Elias appeared to them, and spake with him. [And lo! Moses and Elias appeared to them, speaking with him.]

4.verse: And Peter answered, and said to Jesus, Lord, it is good us to be here. If thou wilt, make we here three tabernacles; to thee one, to Moses one, and one to Elias.

5.verse: Yet while he spake, lo! a bright cloud overshadowed them; and lo! a voice out of the cloud, that said, This is my dear-worthy Son, in whom I have well pleased to me; hear ye him.

6.verse: And the disciples heard, and felled down [fell down] on their faces, and dreaded greatly.

7.verse: And Jesus came, and touched them, and said to them, Rise up, and do not ye dread.

8.verse: And they lifted up their eyes, and saw no man, but Jesus alone.

9.verse: And as they came down of the hill, Jesus commanded to them, and said, Say ye to no man the vision, till man's Son rise again from death.

10.verse: And his disciples asked him, and said, What then say the scribes, that it behooveth that Elias come first? [And his disciples asked him, saying, What therefore say scribes, that it behooveth Elias first come?]

11.verse: [And] He answered, and said to them, [Forsooth] Elias shall come, and he shall restore all things.

12.verse: And I say to you, that Elias is now come, and they knew him not, but they did in him whatever things they would; and so man's Son shall suffer of them.

13.verse: Then the disciples understood, that he said to them of John the Baptist.

14.verse: And when he came to the people [And when he came to the company], a man came to him, and felled [fell] down on his knees before him, and said [saying],

15.verse: Lord, have mercy on my son; for he is lunatic, and suffereth evil, for oft times he falleth into the fire, and oft times into the water.

16.verse: And I brought him to thy disciples, and they might not heal him.

17.verse: Jesus answered, and said, A! thou generation unbelieveful [unbelieveful, or out of the faith,] and wayward; how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? Bring ye him hither to me.

18.verse: And Jesus blamed him, and the devil went out from him; and the child was healed from that hour.

19.verse: Then the disciples came to Jesus privily, and said to him, Why might not we cast him out?

20.verse: Jesus saith to them [Jesus said to them], For your unbelief. Truly I say to you, if ye have faith, as a corn of mustard seed, ye shall say to this hill, Pass thou hence [Pass thou from hence], and it shall pass; and nothing shall be impossible to you;

21.verse: but this kind is not cast out, but by prayer and fasting.

22.verse: And whiles they were abiding together in Galilee, Jesus said to them, Man's Son shall be betrayed into the hands of men;

23.verse: and they shall slay him, and the third day he shall rise again to life [and the third day he shall rise again]. And they were full sorry.

24.verse: And when they came to Capernaum, they that took tribute, came to Peter, and said to him, Your master payeth not tribute?

25.verse: And he said, Yes. And when he was come into the house, Jesus came before him, and said, Simon, what seemeth to thee? Kings of the earth, of whom take they tribute? of their sons, either of aliens?

26.verse: And he said, Of aliens. Jesus said to him, Then sons be free.

27.verse: But that we offend them not, go thou to the sea, and cast an hook, and take that fish that first cometh up; and, when his mouth is opened, thou shalt find a stater [a stater, that is, a certain of money]; take it, and give for thee and for me [thou taking it, give to them for me and for thee].

1.verse: In that hour the disciples came to Jesus, and said [saying], Who, guessest thou, is [the] greater in the kingdom of heavens?

2.verse: And Jesus called a little child, and put him in the middle of them; [And Jesus, calling a little child, set him in the midst of them;]

3.verse: and said, I say truth to you [and said, Truly I say to you], but ye be turned, and [be] made as little children, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heavens.

4.verse: Therefore whoever meeketh him[self] as this little child, he is [the] greater in the kingdom of heavens.

5.verse: And he that receiveth one such little child in my name, receiveth me.

6.verse: But whoso causeth to stumble one of these small , that believe in me, it speedeth to him that a millstone of asses be hanged in his neck, and [that] he be drowned in the deepness of the sea.

7.verse: Woe to the world, for causes of stumbling; for it is need that causes of stumbling come; nevertheless woe to that man by whom a cause of stumbling cometh. [Woe to the world, for offences; truly it is need, that offences come; nevertheless, woe to that man by whom an offence cometh.]

8.verse: And if thine hand or thy foot cause thee to stumble, cut it off, and cast it away from thee. It is better to thee to enter to life feeble, either crooked, than having twain hands or two feet to be sent into everlasting fire.

9.verse: And if thine eye cause thee to stumble [And if thine eye offend thee], pull it out, and cast it away from thee. It is better to thee with one eye to enter into life, than having twain eyes to be sent into the fire of hell [than having two eyes to be sent into hell fire].

10.verse: See ye, that ye despise not one of these little. For I say to you, that the angels of them in heavens see evermore the face of my Father that is in heavens [Truly I say to you, for the angels of them in heavens see ever the face of my Father which is in heavens].

11.verse: For man's Son came to save that thing that perished.

12.verse: What seemeth to you? If there were to a man an hundred sheep, and one of them hath erred, whether he shall not leave ninety and nine in desert [whether he shall not leave ninety and nine in the hills], and shall go to seek that that erred?

13.verse: And if it fall that he find it, truly I say to you, that he shall have joy thereof more than on ninety and nine that erred not. [And if it befall that he find it, truly I say to you, for he shall joy thereon more than of ninety and nine that erred not.]

14.verse: So it is not the will of your Father that is in heavens , that one of these little perish.

15.verse: But if thy brother sinneth against thee, go thou, and reprove him, betwixt thee and him alone; if he heareth thee, thou hast won thy brother.

16.verse: And if he heareth thee not, take with thee one or twain, that every word stand in the mouth of twain or three witnesses. [Truly if he shall not hear thee, take with thee one or two, that every word stand in the mouth of two or three witnesses.]

17.verse: And if he heareth not them, say thou to the church. But if he heareth not the church, be he as an heathen and a publican to thee. [That if he shall not hear them, say thou to the church. Forsooth if he shall not hear the church, be he to thee as an heathen man and a publican.]

18.verse: I say to you truly, whatever things ye [shall] bind on earth, those shall be bound also in heaven; and whatever things ye [shall] unbind on earth, those shall be unbound also in heaven. [I say to you truly, whatever things ye shall bind on earth, shall be bound also in heaven; and whatever things ye shall unbind on earth, shall be unbound also in heaven.]

19.verse: Again I say to you, that if twain of you consent on earth, of every thing whatever they ask, it shall be done to them of my Father that is in heavens.

20.verse: For where twain or three be gathered in my name, there I am in the middle of them. [For where two or three be gathered in my name, there I am in the midst of them.]

21.verse: Then Peter came to him, and said, Lord, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I shall forgive him? Whether till seven times?

22.verse: Jesus saith to him, I say not to thee, till seven times; but till seventy times seven times.

23.verse: Therefore the kingdom of heavens is likened to a king, that would reckon with his servants.

24.verse: And when he began to reckon, one that owed to him ten thousand talents, was brought to him .

25.verse: And when he had not whereof to yield, his lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and children, and all things that he had, and to be paid.

26.verse: But that servant felled down, and prayed him, and said [saying], Have patience in me, and I shall yield to thee all things.

27.verse: And the lord had mercy on that servant, and suffered him to go, and forgave him the debt.

28.verse: But that servant went out, and found one of his even-servants, that owed him an hundred pence; and he held him, and strangled him, and said [saying], Yield that that thou owest.

29.verse: And his even-servant fell down, and prayed him, and said [saying], Have patience in me, and I shall requite all things to thee.

30.verse: But he would not; but went out, and put him into prison [but went and sent him into prison], till he [had] paid all the debt.

31.verse: And his even-servants, seeing the things that were done, [were] sorrowed greatly. And they came, and told to their lord all the things that were done.

32.verse: Then his lord called him, and said to him, Wicked servant, I forgave to thee all the debt, for thou prayedest me.

33.verse: Therefore whether it behooved not also thee to have mercy on thine even-servant [on thy even-servant], as [also] I had mercy on thee?

34.verse: And his lord was wroth, and took him to tormentors [And his lord wroth, betook him to tormentors], till he [had] paid all the debt.

35.verse: So [and] my Father of heaven shall do to you, if ye forgive not every man to his brother, of your hearts.

1.verse: And it was done, when Jesus had ended these words, he passed from Galilee, and came into the coasts of Judaea over Jordan.

2.verse: And much people followed him [And many companies followed him], and he healed them there.

3.verse: And the Pharisees came to him, tempting him, and said, Whether it be leaveful to a man to leave his wife, for any cause?

4.verse: Which answered, and said to them, Have ye not read, for he that made men at the beginning, made them male and female?

5.verse: And he said, For this thing a man shall leave father and mother, and he shall draw to his wife [and he shall cleave, or draw, to his wife]; and they shall be twain in one flesh.

6.verse: And so they be not now twain, but one flesh. Therefore man separate not that thing that God hath joined [together]. [Therefore they be not two, but one flesh. Therefore a man part not that thing that God enjoined, or knit together.]

7.verse: They say to him, What then commanded Moses, to give a libel of forsaking, and to leave of. [They say to him, What then commanded Moses, to give a little book of forsaking, and to forsake.]

8.verse: And he said to them, For Moses, for the hardness of your heart, suffered you to leave your wives [And he saith to them, For Moses, at the hardness of your heart, suffered you to forsake your wives]; but from the beginning it was not so.

9.verse: And I say to you, that whoever leaveth his wife, but for fornication, and weddeth another, doeth lechery [doeth adultery]; and he that weddeth the forsaken wife, doeth lechery [doeth adultery].

10.verse: His disciples say to him, If the cause of a man with his wife is so, it speedeth not to be wedded [it speedeth not to wed].

11.verse: And he said to them, Not all men take this word; but they to which it is given [but to whom it is given].

12.verse: For there be geldings, which be so born of the mother's womb [which be thus born of their mother's womb]; and there be geldings, that be made of men; and there be geldings, that have gelded themselves, for the kingdom of heavens. He that may take, take he.

13.verse: Then little children were brought to him, that he should put [his] hands to them, and pray. And the disciples blamed them.

14.verse: But Jesus said to them, Suffer ye that little children come to me, and do not ye forbid them [But Jesus said to them, Suffer ye little children come to me, and do not ye forbid them to come to me]; for of such is the kingdom of heavens.

15.verse: And when he had put to them hands, he went from thence. [And when he had put to them hands, he went thence.]

16.verse: And lo! one came, and said to him, Good master, what good [thing] shall I do, that I have everlasting life?

17.verse: Which saith to him, What askest thou me of good thing? There is one good God [Which said to him, What askest thou me of good thing? One is good God]. But if thou wilt enter into life, keep the commandments.

18.verse: He saith to him, Which? And Jesus said, Thou shalt not do manslaying, thou shalt not do adultery, thou shalt not do theft, thou shalt not say false witnessing;

19.verse: worship thy father and thy mother [honour thou thy father and thy mother], and, thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

20.verse: The young man saith to him, I have kept all these things from my youth, what yet faileth to me?

21.verse: Jesus saith to him, If thou wilt be perfect, go, and sell all things that thou hast, and give to poor men, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven; and come, and follow me.

22.verse: And when the young man had heard these words, he went away sorrowful, for he had many possessions.

23.verse: And Jesus said to his disciples, I say to you truth, for a rich man of hard shall enter into the kingdom of heavens. [Forsooth Jesus said to his disciples, Truly I say to you, for of hard a rich man shall enter into the realm of heavens.]

24.verse: And again I say to you, it is lighter a camel to pass through a needle's eye , than a rich man to enter into the kingdom of heavens.

25.verse: When these things were heard, the disciples wondered greatly, and said [Truly these words heard, the disciples wondered greatly, saying], Who then may be safe?

26.verse: Jesus beheld, and said to them, With men this thing is impossible; but with God all things be possible.

27.verse: Then Peter answered, and said to him, Lo! we have forsaken all things, and we have followed thee; what then shall be to us [what therefore shall be to us]?

28.verse: And Jesus said to them, Truly I say to you, that ye that have forsaken all things, and have followed me, in the regeneration when man's Son shall sit in the seat of his majesty, [also] ye shall sit on twelve seats [and ye shall sit on twelve seats, or sieges], deeming the twelve kindreds of Israel.

29.verse: And every man that forsaketh house, [or] brethren or sisters [or brethren, or sistren], [or] father or mother, [or] wife or children, or fields, for my name, he shall take an hundredfold, and shall wield everlasting life.

30.verse: But many shall be, the first the last, and the last the first.

1.verse: The kingdom of heavens is like to an husbandman, that went out first by the morrow [that went out early, or by the morrow], to hire workmen into his vineyard.

2.verse: And when the covenant was made with the workmen, of a penny for the day, he sent them into his vineyard.

3.verse: And he went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the market.

4.verse: And he said to them, Go ye also into mine vineyard [Go ye also into my vinery], and that that shall be rightful, I shall give to you. And they went forth.

5.verse: Again he went out about the sixth hour, and the ninth, and did in like manner.

6.verse: But about the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing; and said to them, What stand ye idle here all day [What stand ye here idle all day]?

7.verse: They say to him, For no man hath hired us. He saith to them, Go ye also into my vineyard.

8.verse: And when evening was come, the lord of the vineyard saith to his procurator, Call the workmen, and yield to them their hire, and begin thou at the last till to the first [beginning at the last till to the first].

9.verse: And so when they were come, that came about the eleventh hour, also they took every each of them a penny.

10.verse: But the first came, and deemed, that they should take more, but they took each one by themselves a penny;

11.verse: and in the taking they grumbled against the husbandman, [And they taking grutched against the husbandman,]

12.verse: and said [saying], These last wrought one hour, and thou hast made them even to us, that have borne the charge of the day, and [the] heat?

13.verse: And he answered to one of them, and said, Friend, I do thee none wrong [Friend, I do thee no wrong]; whether thou hast not accorded with me for a penny?

14.verse: Take thou that that is thine, and go; for I will give to this last man, as to thee.

15.verse: Whether it is not leaveful to me to do that that I will? Whether thine eye is wicked, for I am good?

16.verse: So the last shall be the first, and the first the last; for many be called, but few be chosen [for many be called, but few chosen].

17.verse: And Jesus went up to Jerusalem, and took his twelve disciples in private, and said to them, [And Jesus, ascending up to Jerusalem, took his twelve disciples in private, and said to them,]

18.verse: Lo! we go up to Jerusalem, and man's Son shall be betaken to princes of priests, and to scribes; and they shall condemn him to death.

19.verse: And they shall betake him to heathen men, for to be scorned, and scourged, and crucified; and the third day he shall rise again to life. [And they shall betake him to heathen men, to be scorned, and scourged, and crucified; and the third day he shall rise again.]

20.verse: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to him with her sons, honouring, and asking something of him. [Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came nigh to him with her sons, worshipping, and asking something of him.]

21.verse: And he said to her, What wilt thou? She saith to him, Say that these two my sons sit [Say that these my two sons sit], one at thy right half, and one at thy left half, in thy kingdom.

22.verse: [Forsooth] Jesus answered, and said, Ye know not what ye ask. Be ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of [Be ye able to drink the cup that I am to drink]? They say to him, We be able.

23.verse: He saith to them, Ye shall drink my cup; but to sit at my right half or [at my] left half, is not mine to give to you; but to whom it is made ready of my Father.

24.verse: And the ten hearing, had indignation of the two brethren.

25.verse: But Jesus called them to him, and said, Ye know, that [the] princes of heathen men be lords of them, and they that be [the] greater, use power on them [and they that be more, haunt power on them].

26.verse: It shall not be so among you; but whoever will be made greater among you [but whoever will be made more among you], be he your minister;

27.verse: and whoever among you will be the first [and whoever among you will be first], he shall be your servant.

28.verse: As man's Son came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life redemption for many.

29.verse: And when they went out of Jericho, much people followed him. [And they going out of Jericho, many companies followed him.]

30.verse: And lo! two blind men sat beside the way, and heard that Jesus passed; and they cried, and said, Lord, the son of David, have mercy on us. [And lo! two blind men sitting beside the way, heard that Jesus passed; and they cried, saying, Lord, the son of David, have mercy on us.]

31.verse: And the people blamed them, that they should be still; and they cried the more, and said, Lord, the son of David, have mercy on us. [Forsooth the company blamed them, that they should be still; and they cried more, saying, Lord, the son of David, have mercy on us.]

32.verse: And Jesus stood, and called them, and said, What will ye, that I do to you?

33.verse: They say to him, Lord, that our eyes be opened.

34.verse: And Jesus had mercy on them, and touched their eyes; and at once [and anon] they saw, and followed him.

1.verse: And when Jesus came nigh to Jerusalem, and came to Bethphage, at the mount of Olives, then sent he his two disciples, [And when Jesus came nigh to Jerusalem, and came to Bethphage, to the mount of Olives, then Jesus sent his two disciples,]

2.verse: and said to them [saying to them], Go ye into the castle that is against you, and at once [and anon] ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her; untie ye, and bring to me.

3.verse: And if any man say to you any thing, say ye, that the Lord hath need to them; and at once he shall let them go [and anon he shall leave them].

4.verse: All this was done, that that thing should be fulfilled, that was said by the prophet, saying,

5.verse: Say ye to the daughter of Sion, Lo! thy king cometh to thee, meek, sitting on an ass, and a foal of an ass under yoke [and a colt of a beast under yoke].

6.verse: And the disciples went, and did as Jesus commanded them.

7.verse: And they brought an ass, and the foal, and laid their clothes on them , and made him sit above.

8.verse: And full much people spreaded their clothes in the way; others cutted branches of trees, and strewed in the way. [Forsooth full much company spreaded their clothes in the way; soothly others cut branches of trees, and strowed in the way.]

9.verse: And the people that went before, and that followed, cried, and said [Forsooth the companies that went before, and that followed, cried, saying], Hosanna to the son of David; blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord; Hosanna in high things [Hosanna in the highest things].

10.verse: And when he was entered into Jerusalem, all the city was stirred, and said, Who is this? [And when he had entered into Jerusalem, all the city was stirred, saying, Who is this?]

11.verse: But [Forsooth] the people said, This is Jesus, the prophet, of Nazareth of Galilee.

12.verse: And Jesus entered into the temple of God, and cast out of the temple all that bought and sold [and cast out of the temple all men selling and buying]; and he turned upside-down the boards of changers, and the chairs of men that sold culvers.

13.verse: And he said to them, It is written, Mine house shall be called an house of prayer [My house shall be called an house of prayer]; but ye have made it a den of thieves.

14.verse: And blind and crooked came to him in the temple, and he healed them.

15.verse: But the princes of priests and the scribes, seeing the marvelous things that he did, and the children crying in the temple, and saying, Hosanna to the son of David, they had indignation,

16.verse: and said to him, Hearest thou what these say? And Jesus said to them [Soothly Jesus saith to them], Yea; whether ye have never read, That of the mouth of young children, and of suckling children, thou hast made perfect praising?

17.verse: And when he had left them, he went forth out of the city, into Bethany; and there he dwelt, and taught them of the kingdom of God.

18.verse: But on the morrow, he, turning again into the city, hungered.

19.verse: And he saw a fig tree beside the way, and came to it, and found nothing therein [and found nothing thereon] but leaves only. And he said to it, Never fruit come forth of thee [Never be fruit born of thee], into without end. And at once [And anon] the fig tree was dried up.

20.verse: And the disciples saw, and wondered, saying, How at once it dried.

21.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to them, Truly I say to you, if ye have faith, and doubt not, not only ye shall do of the fig tree, but also if ye say to this hill, Take [away thee], and cast thee into the sea, it shall be done so [it shall be done].

22.verse: And all things whatever ye believing shall ask in prayer, ye shall take. [And all things whatever ye shall ask in prayer believing, ye shall take.]

23.verse: And when he came into the temple, the princes of priests and elder men of the people came to him that taught, and said [And when he came into the temple, the princes of priests and the elder men of the people came nigh to him teaching, and said], In what power doest thou these things? and who gave thee this power?

24.verse: Jesus answered, and said to them, And I shall ask you one word, the which if ye tell me [which if ye shall say to me], I shall say to you, in what power I do these things.

25.verse: Of whence was the baptism of John; of heaven, or of men? And they thought within themselves, saying, If we [shall] say of heaven, he shall say to us, Why then believe ye not to him?

26.verse: [Soothly] If we [shall] say of men, we dread the people, for all had John as a prophet.

27.verse: And they answered to Jesus, and said, We know not. And he said to them, Neither I say to you, in what power I do these things.

28.verse: But what seemeth to you? A man had two sons [Some man had two sons]; and he came to the first, and said, Son, go work this day [to day] in my vineyard.

29.verse: And he answered, and said, I will not; but afterward he repented, and went forth [but afterward he stirred by penance, or repenting, went].

30.verse: But he came to the other, and said in like manner. And he answered, and said, Lord, I go; and he went not.

31.verse: Who of the twain did the father's will? They say to him, The first. Jesus saith to them, Truly I say to you, for publicans and whores shall go before you into the kingdom of God.

32.verse: For John came to you in the way of rightwiseness, and ye believed not to him; but publicans and whores believed to him. But ye saw, and had no repenting after, that ye believed to him [But ye seeing, had not penance afterward, that ye should believe to him].

33.verse: Hear ye another parable. There was an husbandman, that planted a vineyard, and hedged it about, and delved a presser therein, and builded a tower [and built a tower], and hired it to earth-tillers, and went far in pilgrimage.

34.verse: And when the time of fruits approached, he sent his servants to the earth-tillers, to take fruits of it.

35.verse: And the earth-tillers took his servants, and they beat one, they slew another, and stoned another. [And, his servants taken, the earth-tillers beat one, they killed another, forsooth they stoned another.]

36.verse: Again he sent other servants, more than the first, and in like manner they did to them [and they did to them in like manner].

37.verse: And at the last he sent his son to them, and said [saying], They shall dread my son.

38.verse: But the earth-tillers, seeing the son, said within themselves, This is the heir; come ye, slay we him, and we shall have his heritage.

39.verse: And they took him, and casted [cast] him out of the vineyard, and slew him.

40.verse: Therefore when the lord of the vineyard shall come, what shall he do to those earth-tillers?

41.verse: They say to him, He shall destroy evil the evil men, and he shall set to hire his vineyard to other earth-tillers, which shall yield to him fruit in their times.

42.verse: Jesus saith to them, Read ye never in scriptures, The stone which the builders reproved, this is made into the head of the corner? Of the Lord this thing is done, and it is marvelous in our eyes.

43.verse: Therefore I say to you, that the kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and shall be given to a folk doing [the] fruits of it.

44.verse: And he that shall fall on this stone, shall be broken; but on whom it shall fall, it shall bruise him all to pieces [it shall pound him all to pieces].

45.verse: And when the princes of priests and [the] Pharisees had heard his parables, they knew that he [had] said of them.

46.verse: And they sought to hold him, but they dreaded the people [And they, seeking to hold him, dreaded the companies], for they had him as a prophet.

1.verse: And Jesus answered, and spake again in parables to them, and said,

2.verse: The kingdom of heavens is made like to a king that made weddings to his son. [The kingdom of heavens is like to a man king that made weddings to his son.]

3.verse: And he sent his servants to call men that were bidden to the weddings, and they would not come.

4.verse: Again he sent other servants, and said [saying], Say to the men that be bidden to the feast, Lo! I have made ready my meat, my bulls and my volatiles be slain [my bulls and my volatiles, or my fat beasts, be slain], and all things be ready; come ye to the weddings.

5.verse: But they despised, and went forth, one into his town, another to his merchandise. [Soothly they despised, or reckoned not, and they went away, one into his vineyard, forsooth another to his merchandise.]

6.verse: But [the] others held his servants, and tormented them, and slew [them].

7.verse: But the king, when he had heard, was wroth; and he sent his hosts, and destroyed those man-quellers, and burnt their city.

8.verse: Then he said to his servants [Then he saith to his servants], The weddings be ready, but they that were called to the feast, were not worthy.

9.verse: Therefore go ye into the ends of ways, and whomever ye find, call ye to the weddings. [Therefore go ye to the outgoings, or ends, of ways, and whomever ye shall find, call to the weddings.]

10.verse: And his servants went out into the ways, and gathered together all that they found, good and evil; and the bridal [and the weddings] was full-filled with men sitting at the meat.

11.verse: And the king entered, to see men sitting at the meat; and he saw there a man not clothed with bride clothes [and he saw there a man not clothed with bridal clothes].

12.verse: And he said to him, Friend, how enteredest thou hither without bride clothes [And he saith to him, Friend, how enteredest thou hither, not having bride clothes]? And he was dumb.

13.verse: Then the king bade his ministers, Bind him both hands and feet, and send ye him into outer-more darknesses; there shall be weeping and grinding of teeth. [Then the king said to the ministers, His hands and feet bound, send ye him into utter-more darknesses; there shall be weeping and beating together of teeth.]

14.verse: For many be called, but few be chosen.

15.verse: Then Pharisees went away, and took a counsel to take Jesus in word. [Then Pharisees, going away, took a counsel, that they should take him in word.]

16.verse: And they send to him their disciples, with Herodians, and said [saying], Master, we know, that thou art soothfast, and thou teachest in truth the way of God, and thou carest not of any man [and there is no care, or charge, to thee of any man], for thou beholdest not the person of men.

17.verse: Therefore say to us, what seemeth to thee. Is it leaveful that tribute be given to the emperor, either nay ?

18.verse: And when Jesus had known the wickedness of them, he said, Hypocrites, what tempt ye me?

19.verse: Show ye to me the print of the money. And they brought to him a penny.

20.verse: And Jesus said to them [And Jesus saith to them], Whose is this image, and the writing above?

21.verse: They say to him, The emperor's. Then he said to them, Therefore yield ye to the emperor those things that be the emperor's, and to God those things that be of God.

22.verse: And they heard, and wondered; and they left him, and went away. [And they hearing wondered; and, him left, they went away.]

23.verse: In that day Sadducees, that say there is no rising again to life [that say there is no rising again], came to him, and asked him,

24.verse: and said, Master, Moses said, if any man is dead [saying, Master, Moses said, if any man be dead], not having a son, that his brother wed his wife, and raise seed to his brother.

25.verse: And there were seven brethren to us; and the first wedded a wife, and is dead. And he had no seed, and left his wife to his brother; [Forsooth seven brethren were with us; and the first, a wife wedded, is dead. And he not having seed, left his wife to his brother;]

26.verse: also the second, and the third, till to the seventh.

27.verse: But the last of all, [also] the woman is dead.

28.verse: Also in the rising again to life [Therefore in the rising again], whose wife of the seven shall she be? for all had her.

29.verse: Jesus answered, and said to them, Ye err, not knowing the scriptures, nor the virtue of God.

30.verse: For in the rising again to life, neither they shall wed, neither shall be wedded [For in the rising again, neither they wed, neither be wedded]; but they be as the angels of God in heaven.

31.verse: And of the rising again of dead men, have ye not read, that [it] is said of the Lord, that saith to you [that it is said of the Lord, saying to you],

32.verse: I am God of Abraham, and God of Isaac, and God of Jacob? he is not God of dead men, but of living men.

33.verse: And the people hearing [And the companies hearing], wondered on his teaching.

34.verse: And the Pharisees heard that he had put silence to Sadducees, and came together.

35.verse: And one of them, a teacher of the law, asked Jesus, and tempted him, [And one of them, a teacher of the law, asked Jesus, tempting him,]

36.verse: Master, which is a great commandment in the law?

37.verse: Jesus said to him, Thou shalt love thy Lord God, of all thine heart, and in all thy soul, and in all thy mind [Thou shalt love the Lord thy God, of all thine heart, and of all thy soul, and in all thy mind].

38.verse: This is the first and the most commandment.

39.verse: And the second is like to this; Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

40.verse: In these two commandments hangeth all the law and the prophets.

41.verse: And when the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,

42.verse: and said [saying], What seemeth to you of Christ, whose son is he? They say to him, Of David.

43.verse: He saith to them, How then David in spirit calleth him Lord, and saith [saying],

44.verse: The Lord said to my Lord, Sit [thou] on my right half, till I put thine enemies a stool of thy feet?

45.verse: Then if David calleth him Lord, how is he his son?

46.verse: And no man might answer a word to him, neither any man was hardy from that day, to ask him more.

1.verse: Then Jesus spake to the people, and to his disciples, [Then Jesus spake to the companies, and to his disciples,]

2.verse: and said, On the chair of Moses, scribes and Pharisees have sat. [saying, Scribes and Pharisees sat on the chair of Moses.]

3.verse: Therefore keep ye, and do ye all things, whatever things they say to you [whatever they shall say to you]. But do not ye do after their works; for they say, and do not.

4.verse: And they bind grievous charges, and that be not able to be borne [Soothly they bind grievous charges, and unportable, or that may not be borne], and put on [the] shoulders of men; but with their finger they will not move them.

5.verse: Therefore [Forsooth] they do all their works to be seen of men; for they draw abroad their phylacteries, and magnify [their] hems.

6.verse: And they love the first sitting places in suppers [Soothly they love the first sitting places at suppers], and the first chairs in synagogues;

7.verse: and salutations in [the] market, and to be called of men, master [and to be called of men, masters].

8.verse: But do not ye be called master; for one is your master, and all ye be brethren.

9.verse: And do not ye call to you a father on earth [And do not ye call to you a father upon earth], for one is your Father, that is in heavens.

10.verse: Neither be ye called masters, for one is your master, Christ.

11.verse: He that is greatest among you, shall be your minister.

12.verse: For he that higheth himself, shall be meeked; and he that meeketh himself, shall be enhanced. [Forsooth he that shall high himself, shall be meeked; and he that shall meek himself, shall be enhanced.]

13.verse: But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, that close the kingdom of heavens before men; and ye enter not, neither suffer other men entering to enter .

14.verse: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, that eat the houses of widows, and pray by long prayer; for this thing ye shall take the more doom.

15.verse: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, that go about the sea and the land, to make one proselyte [that compass the sea and the land, to make one proselyte, that is, converted to your order]; and when he is made, ye make him a son of hell, double more than ye be [double more than you].

16.verse: Woe to you, blind leaders, that say, Whoever sweareth by the temple of God, it is nothing; but he that sweareth in the gold of the temple, is debtor.

17.verse: Ye fools and blind, for what is greater, the gold, or the temple that halloweth the gold?

18.verse: And whoever sweareth in the altar [And whoever shall swear in the altar], it is nothing; but he that sweareth in the gift that is on the altar, oweth [is debtor].

19.verse: Blind men, for what is more, the gift, or the altar that halloweth the gift?

20.verse: Therefore he that sweareth in the altar, sweareth in it, and in all things that be thereon.

21.verse: And he that sweareth in the temple, sweareth in it, and in him that dwelleth in the temple.

22.verse: And he that sweareth in heaven, sweareth in the throne of God, and in him that sitteth thereon.

23.verse: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, that tithe mint, anise, and cummin, and have left those things that be of more charge of the law, doom, and mercy, and faith. And it behooved to do these things [And these things it behooved, or needed, to do], and not to leave those.

24.verse: Blind leaders, cleansing a gnat, but swallowing a camel.

25.verse: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, that cleanse the cup and the platter withoutforth [that make clean that thing of the cup and of the platter, that is withoutforth]; but within ye be full of raven and uncleanness.

26.verse: Thou blind Pharisee, cleanse first the cup and the platter withinforth, that that that is withoutforth be made clean.

27.verse: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, that be like to sepulchres whited [that be like to sepulchres made white], which withoutforth seem fair to men; but within they be full of bones of dead men, and of all filth.

28.verse: So [and] ye withoutforth seem just to men [So and ye forsooth withoutforth appear rightful to men]; but within ye be full of hypocrisy and wickedness.

29.verse: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, that build [the] sepulchres of prophets, and make fair the burials of just men,

30.verse: and say, If we had been in the days of our fathers, we should not have been their fellows in the blood of prophets.

31.verse: And so ye be in witnessing to yourselves [And so ye be into witnessing to yourselves], that ye be the sons of them that slew the prophets.

32.verse: And full-fill ye the measure of your fathers. [And fill ye the measure of your fathers.]

33.verse: Ye adders, and adders' brood [Ye serpents, fruits of adders], how shall ye flee from the doom of hell?

34.verse: Therefore lo! I send to you prophets, and wise men, and scribes [Therefore lo! I send to you prophets, and wise men, and scribes, or writers]; and of them ye shall slay and crucify, and of them ye shall scourge in your synagogues, and shall pursue from city into city;

35.verse: that all the just blood come on [upon] you, that was shed on the earth, from the blood of just Abel [till] to the blood of Zacharias, the son of Barachias, whom ye slew betwixt the temple and the altar [whom ye slew between the temple and the altar].

36.verse: Truly I say to you, all these things shall come on [upon] this generation.

37.verse: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that slayest prophets, and stonest them that be sent to thee, how oft would I gather together thy children, as an hen gathereth together her chickens under her wings, and thou wouldest not.

38.verse: Lo! your house shall be left to you desert.

39.verse: And I say to you, ye shall not see me from henceforth, till ye say, Blessed is he, that cometh in the name of the Lord.

1.verse: And Jesus went out of the temple [And Jesus gone out of the temple, went]; and his disciples came to him, to show him the buildings of the temple.

2.verse: But he answered, and said to them, See ye all these things? Truly I say to you, a stone shall not be left here on one stone, that not it shall be destroyed [Truly I say to you, a stone shall not be left here on a stone, which shall not destroyed].

3.verse: And when he sat on the mount of Olives, his disciples came to him privily, and said [saying], Say to us, when these things shall be, and what token of thy coming, and of the ending of the world.

4.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to them, Look ye [See ye], that no man deceive you.

5.verse: For many shall come in my name, and shall say, I am Christ [For many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ]; and they shall deceive many.

6.verse: For ye shall hear battles, and opinions of battles; see ye that ye be not disturbed [see ye, that ye be not distroubled]; for it behooveth these things to be done, but not yet is the end.

7.verse: For folk shall rise together against folk, and realm against realm, and pestilences, and hungers, and earth-movings shall be by places;

8.verse: and all these be beginnings of sorrows.

9.verse: Then men shall betake you into tribulation, and shall slay you, and ye shall be in hate to all folks for my name. [Then they shall betake you into tribulation, and they shall slay you, and ye shall be in hatred to all folks for my name.]

10.verse: And then many shall be caused to stumble [And then many shall be offended], and [they shall] betray each other, and they shall hate each other.

11.verse: And many false prophets shall rise, and [they shall] deceive many.

12.verse: And for wickedness shall be plenteous, the charity of many shall wax cold;

13.verse: but he that shall dwell still into the end, shall be safe.

14.verse: And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in all the world, in [into] witnessing to all folks; and then the end shall come.

15.verse: Therefore when ye see the abomination of discomfort [Therefore when ye shall see the abomination of discording], that is said of Daniel, the prophet, standing in the holy place; he that readeth, understand he [he that readeth, understand];

16.verse: then they that be in Judaea, flee to the mountains;

17.verse: and he that is in the house roof, come not down to take any thing of his house;

18.verse: and he that is in the field, turn not again to take his coat.

19.verse: But woe to them that be with child, and nourishing in those days [and nursing in those days].

20.verse: [Soothly] Pray ye, that your flying be not made in winter, or in the sabbath.

21.verse: For then shall be great tribulation, what manner was not from the beginning of the world to now [what manner was not from the beginning of the world till now], neither shall be made.

22.verse: And but those days had been abridged, each flesh should not be made safe ; but those days shall be made short, for the chosen men.

23.verse: Then if any man [shall] say to you, Lo! here is Christ, or there, do not ye believe.

24.verse: For false Christs and false prophets shall rise, and they shall give great tokens and wonders [and they shall give great signs and wonders]; so that also the chosen be led into error, if it may be done.

25.verse: Lo! I have before-said to you.

26.verse: Therefore if they [shall] say to you, Lo! he is in desert, do not ye go out; lo! he is in privy places [lo! in privy chambers, or places], do not ye believe.

27.verse: For as lightning goeth out from the east, and appeareth [till] into the west, so shall be also the coming of man's Son.

28.verse: Where ever the body shall be, also the eagles shall be gathered thither.

29.verse: And at once [Forsooth anon] after the tribulation of those days, the sun shall be made dark, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the virtues of heavens shall be moved [and the virtues of heavens shall be stirred].

30.verse: And then the token of man's Son shall appear in heaven, and then all the kindreds of the earth shall wail [and then all the kindreds, or lineages, of the earth shall wail]; and they shall see man's Son coming in the clouds of heaven, with much virtue and majesty.

31.verse: And he shall send his angels with a trumpet, and a great voice; and they shall gather his chosen from four winds, from the highest things of heaven to the ends of them. [And he shall send his angels with a trump, and great voice; and they shall gather his chosen from four winds, from the highest things of heavens till to the terms, or ends, of them.]

32.verse: And learn ye the parable of the fig tree. When his branch is now tender, and the leaves be sprung, ye know that summer is nigh;

33.verse: so and ye when ye shall see all these things [so also when ye shall see all these things], know ye that it is nigh, in the gates.

34.verse: Truly I say to you, for this generation shall not pass, till all things be done;

35.verse: heaven and earth shall pass, but my words shall not pass.

36.verse: But of that day and hour no man knoweth, neither [the] angels of heaven [neither the angels of heavens], but the Father alone.

37.verse: But as it was in the days of Noe, so shall be [also] the coming of man's Son.

38.verse: For as in the days before the great flood, they were eating and drinking, wedding and taking to wedding, till that day [till into the day], that Noe entered into the ship;

39.verse: and they knew not, till the great flood came, and took all men, so shall be the coming of man's Son.

40.verse: Then twain shall be in a field [Then two shall be in a field], one shall be taken, and the other left;

41.verse: two women shall be grinding in a quern [two women shall be grinding in one mill], one shall be taken, and the other left; twain in a bed [two in a bed], the one shall be taken, and the other left.

42.verse: Therefore wake ye, for ye know not in what hour the Lord shall come. [Therefore wake ye, for ye know not in what hour your Lord is to come.]

43.verse: But know ye this, that if the husbandman knew in what hour the thief were to come [for if the husbandman knew in what hour the thief should come], certainly he would wake, and suffer not his house to be undermined.

44.verse: And therefore [also] be ye ready [Therefore and ye be ready], for in what hour ye guess not, man's Son shall come.

45.verse: Who guessest thou is a true servant and prudent [Who guessest thou is a faithful servant and prudent], whom his lord ordained on his household, to give them meat in time?

46.verse: Blessed is that servant, whom his lord, when he shall come [when he come], shall find so doing.

47.verse: Truly I say to you, for on [upon] all his goods he shall ordain him.

48.verse: But if that evil servant [shall] say in his heart, My lord tarrieth to come,

49.verse: and beginneth to smite his even-servants [and shall begin to smite his even-servants], and to eat, and drink with drunken men;

50.verse: the lord of that servant shall come in the day [in] which he hopeth not, and in the hour that he knoweth not,

51.verse: and shall part him (in pieces), and put his part with hypocrites; there shall be weeping, and grinding of teeth [there shall be weeping, and beating together of teeth].

1.verse: Then the kingdom of heavens shall be like to ten virgins, which took their lamps, and went out to meet the husband and the wife ;

2.verse: and five of them were fools, and five prudent.

3.verse: But the five fools took their lamps, and took not oil with them;

4.verse: but the prudent took oil in their vessels with the lamps.

5.verse: And whiles the husband [the spouse, or husband,] tarried, all they napped and slept.

6.verse: But at midnight a cry was made, Lo! the spouse cometh, go ye out to meet with him [go ye out to meet him].

7.verse: Then all those virgins rose up, and arrayed their lamps [and adorned their lamps].

8.verse: And the fools said to the wise, Give ye to us of your oil, for our lamps be quenched.

9.verse: The prudent answered, and said [saying], Lest peradventure it suffice not to us and to you, go ye rather to men that sell, and buy to you.

10.verse: And while they went to buy, the spouse came; and those that were ready, entered [in] with him to the weddings; and the gate was shut.

11.verse: And at the last the other virgins came, and said, Lord, Lord, open to us.

12.verse: And he answered, and said, Truly I say to you, I know you not.

13.verse: Therefore wake ye, for ye know not the day nor the hour.

14.verse: For as a man that goeth in pilgrimage [Soothly as a man going far in pilgrimage], called his servants, and betook to them his goods;

15.verse: and to one he gave five talents, to another twain [and to one he gave five talents, or bezants, forsooth to another two], and to another one, to each after his own virtue; and he went forth at once [and he went forth anon].

16.verse: And he that had five bezants [Forsooth and he that had taken five talents], went forth, and wrought in them, and won other five.

17.verse: Also and he that had taken twain, won other twain. [Also and he that had taken two, won other two.]

18.verse: But he that had taken one, went forth, and delved in the earth, and hid the money of his lord.

19.verse: But after long time, the lord of those servants came, and reckoned with them.

20.verse: And he that had taken five bezants, came, and brought other five, and said, Lord, thou betookest to me five bezants, lo! I have gotten above five others.

21.verse: His lord said to him, Well be thou, good servant and faithful; for on few things thou hast been true , I shall ordain thee on many things; enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

22.verse: And he that had taken two talents, came, and said, Lord, thou betookest to me two bezants; lo! I have won over other twain.

23.verse: His lord said to him, Well be thou, good servant and true; for on few things thou hast been true , I shall ordain thee on many things; enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

24.verse: But he that had taken one bezant [Forsooth and he that had taken one talent], came, and said, Lord, I know that thou art an hard man; thou reapest where thou hast not sown, and thou gatherest together where thou hast not spreaded abroad;

25.verse: and I dreading went, and hid thy bezant in the earth [and I dreading went, and hid thy talent in the earth]; lo! thou hast that that is thine.

26.verse: His lord answered, and said to him, Evil servant and slow, knewest thou that I reap where I sowed not, and gather together where I spreaded not abroad?

27.verse: Therefore it behooved thee to betake my money to (ex)changers [Therefore it behooved thee to have sent my money to changers], that when I came, I should have received that that is mine with usuries.

28.verse: Therefore take away from him the bezant, and give [ye it] to him that hath ten bezants. [And so take ye away from him the talent, and give ye it to him that hath ten talents.]

29.verse: For to every man that hath me shall give, and he shall increase ; but from him that hath not, also that that he seemeth to have, shall be taken away from him.

30.verse: And cast ye out the unprofitable servant into outer-more darknesses; there shall be weeping, and grinding of teeth. [And cast ye out the unprofitable servant into utter-more darknesses; there shall be weeping, and beating together of teeth.]

31.verse: When man's Son shall come in his majesty, and all his angels with him, then he shall sit on the seat of his majesty [then he shall sit on the siege of his majesty];

32.verse: and all folks shall be gathered before him, and he shall separate them atwain, as a shepherd separateth sheep from kids [and he shall part them atwain, as a shepherd parteth sheep from kids];

33.verse: and he shall set the sheep on his right half, and the kids on the left half [and the kids forsooth on his left half].

34.verse: Then the king shall say to them, that shall be on his right half, Come ye, the blessed of my Father, take ye in possession the kingdom made ready to you from the making of the world [Come ye, the blessed of my Father, wield ye, or take ye in possession, the kingdom made ready to you from the beginning, or making, of the world].

35.verse: For I hungered , and ye gave me to eat; I thirsted, and ye gave me to drink; I was harbourless, and ye harboured me [I was harbourless, and ye gathered, or harboured, me];

36.verse: naked, and ye covered me; sick, and ye visited me; I was in prison, and ye came to me.

37.verse: Then just men shall answer to him, and say [saying], Lord, when saw we thee hungry, and we fed thee; thirsty, and we gave to thee drink [thirsty, and we gave thee drink]?

38.verse: and when saw we thee harbourless, and we harboured thee [when forsooth saw we thee harbourless, and we gathered thee to harbour]; or naked, and we covered thee?

39.verse: or when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and we came to thee?

40.verse: And the king answering shall say to them, Truly I say to you, as long as ye did to one of these my least brethren, ye did to me.

41.verse: Then the king shall say also to them, that shall be on his left half, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, that is made ready to the devil and his angels [which is made ready to the devil and his angels].

42.verse: For I hungered, and ye gave not me to eat; I thirsted, and ye gave not me to drink; [For I hungered, and ye gave not to me for to eat; I thirsted, and ye gave not to me for to drink;]

43.verse: I was harbourless, and ye harboured not me [I was harbourless, and ye gathered not me to harbour]; naked, and ye covered not me; sick, and in prison, and ye visited not me.

44.verse: Then and they shall answer to him, and shall say , Lord, when saw we thee hungering, or thirsting, or harbourless, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and we served not to thee?

45.verse: Then he shall answer to them, and say [saying], Truly I say to you, as long as ye did not to one of these least, neither ye did to me [as long as ye did not to one of these least, ye did not to me].

46.verse: And these shall go into everlasting torment; but the just men shall go into everlasting life.

1.verse: And it was done, when Jesus had ended all these words, he said to his disciples,

2.verse: Ye know, that after two days pask shall be made, and man's Son shall be betaken to be crucified.

3.verse: Then the princes of priests and the elder men of the people were gathered into the hall of the prince of priests, that was said Caiaphas,

4.verse: and made a counsel to hold Jesus with guile, and slay him; [and made a counsel, that they should hold Jesus with guile, and slay him;]

5.verse: but they said, Not in the holiday [soothly they said, Not in the feast day], lest peradventure noise were made in the people.

6.verse: And when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leprous,

7.verse: a woman that had a box of alabaster of precious ointment, came to him [a woman having a box of alabaster of precious ointment, came nigh to him], and shedded it out on the head of him resting.

8.verse: And the disciples seeing had disdain, and said [saying], Whereto is this loss?

9.verse: for it might be sold for much [for this might have been sold for much], and be given to poor men.

10.verse: But Jesus knew, and said to them, What be ye heavy to this woman? for she hath wrought in me a good work [she hath wrought a good work in me].

11.verse: For ye shall ever have poor men with you, but ye shall not always have me. [For why ye shall evermore have poor men with you, but ye shall not all-gates have me.]

12.verse: For this woman sending this ointment into my body, did [for] to bury me.

13.verse: Truly I say to you, where ever this gospel shall be preached in all the world, it shall be said, that she did this, in mind of him [it shall be said and that this woman did, into mind of him].

14.verse: Then one of the twelve, that was called Judas Iscariot, went forth to the princes of priests [went to the princes of priests],

15.verse: and said to them, What will ye give to me, and I shall betake him to you? And they ordained to him thirty pieces of silver.

16.verse: And from that time he sought opportunity [he sought covenability], to betray him.

17.verse: And in the first day of therf loaves, the disciples came to Jesus, and said , Where wilt thou [that] we make ready to thee, [for] to eat pask?

18.verse: [And] Jesus said, Go ye into the city to a man, and say to him, The master saith, My time is nigh; at thee I make pask with my disciples.

19.verse: And the disciples did, as Jesus commanded to them; and they made the pask ready [and they made ready pask].

20.verse: And when the eventide was come, he sat to meat with his twelve disciples. [Forsooth evening made, he sat at the meat with his twelve disciples.]

21.verse: And he said to them, as they ate, Truly I say to you, that one of you shall betray me.

22.verse: And they full sorry began each by himself to say, Lord, whether I am he?

23.verse: And he answered, and said, He that putteth with me his hand in the platter, [this] shall betray me.

24.verse: Forsooth man's Son goeth, as it is written of him; but woe to that man, by whom man's Son shall be betrayed; it were good to him, if that man had not been born.

25.verse: But Judas that betrayed him, answered, saying, Master, whether I am he? Jesus said to him, Thou hast said. [Forsooth Judas that betrayed him, answered, saying, Master, whether it am I? He said to him, Thou hast said.]

26.verse: And while they supped [Forsooth them supping], Jesus took bread, and blessed [it], and brake, and gave to his disciples, and said, Take ye, and eat; this is my body.

27.verse: And he took the cup, and did thankings, and gave to them, and said [saying], Drink ye all thereof;

28.verse: this is my blood of the new testament, which shall be shed for many, into remission of sins.

29.verse: And I say to you, I shall not drink from this time, of this fruit of the vine, [till] into that day when I shall drink it new with you, in the kingdom of my Father.

30.verse: And when the hymn was said, they went out into the mount of Olives.

31.verse: Then Jesus said to them, All ye shall suffer cause of stumbling in me, in this night [Then Jesus saith to them, All ye shall suffer offence in me, this night]; for it is written, I shall smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered.

32.verse: But after that I shall rise again, I shall go before you into Galilee.

33.verse: Peter answered, and said to him, Though all [men] shall be caused to stumble in thee, I shall never be caused to stumble.

34.verse: Jesus said to him, Truly I say to thee, for in this night before the cock crow, thrice thou shalt deny me.

35.verse: Peter said to him, Yea, though it [shall] behoove that I die with thee, I shall not deny thee. Also [and] all the disciples said.

36.verse: Then Jesus came with them into a town, that is said Gethsemane. And he said to his disciples, Sit ye here, while I go thither, and pray.

37.verse: And when he had taken Peter, and two sons of Zebedee, he began to be heavy and sorry [he began to be sorrowful and heavy in heart].

38.verse: Then he said to them, My soul is sorrowful [till] to the death; abide ye here, and wake ye with me. [Then he saith to them, My soul is sorrowful till to the death; sustain ye, or abide ye, here, and wake ye with me.]

39.verse: And he went forth a little, and felled down [fell down] on his face, praying, and saying, My Father, if it is possible, pass this cup from me [praying, and saying, My Father, if it is possible, this cup pass from me]; nevertheless not as I will, but as thou wilt.

40.verse: And he came to his disciples, and found them sleeping. And he said to Peter, So, whether ye might not one hour wake with me ?

41.verse: Wake ye, and pray ye, that ye enter not into temptation; for the spirit is ready, but the flesh is frail.

42.verse: Again the second time he went, and prayed, saying, My Father, if this cup may not pass, but I drink it, thy will be done.

43.verse: And again he came, and found them sleeping; for their eyes were heavied.

44.verse: And he left them, and went again, and prayed the third time, and said the same word. [And them left, he went again, and prayed the third time, the same word saying.]

45.verse: Then he came to his disciples, and said to them, Sleep ye now, and rest ye; lo! the hour hath approached, and man's Son shall be betaken into the hands of sinners;

46.verse: rise ye, go we; lo! he that shall take me, is nigh. [rise ye, go we; lo! he that shall betray me, hath nighed.]

47.verse: [And] Yet while he spake, lo! Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great company, with swords and bats [with swords and staves], sent from the princes of priests, and from the elder men of the people.

48.verse: And he that betrayed him, gave to them a token, and said [saying], Whomever I shall kiss, he it is; hold ye him.

49.verse: And at once [And anon] he came to Jesus, and said, Hail, master; and he kissed him.

50.verse: And Jesus said to him, Friend, whereto art thou come? Then they came nigh, and laid hands on Jesus, and held him.

51.verse: And lo! one of them that were with Jesus, stretched out his hand, and drew out his sword; and he smote the servant of the prince of priests, and cut off his ear .

52.verse: Then Jesus said to him, Turn thy sword into his place; for all that take sword, shall perish by sword.

53.verse: Whether guessest thou, that I may not pray my Father, and he shall give to me now more than twelve legions of angels?

54.verse: How then shall the scriptures be fulfilled? for so it behooveth to be done.

55.verse: In that hour Jesus said to the people, As to a thief ye have gone out, with swords and bats, [for] to take me; day by day I sat among you, and taught in the temple, and ye held me not.

56.verse: But all this thing was done, that the scriptures of prophets should be fulfilled. Then all the disciples fled, and left him [Then all the disciples fled, him forsaken].

57.verse: And they held Jesus, and led him to Caiaphas, the prince of priests, where the scribes and the Pharisees, and the elder men of the people were come together. [And they holding Jesus, led him to Caiaphas, prince of priests, where the scribes and the elder men of the people had come together.]

58.verse: But Peter followed him afar, [till] into the hall of the prince of priests; and he went in, and sat with the servants, to see the end.

59.verse: And the prince of priests, and all the council sought false witnessing against Jesus, that they should take him to death; [Forsooth the princes of priests, and all the council sought false witnessing against Jesus, that they should betake him to death;]

60.verse: and they found not, when many false witnesses were come. But at the last, two false witnesses came,

61.verse: and said, This said, I may destroy the temple of God, and after the third day build it again [and after three days built it again].

62.verse: And the prince of priests rose, and said to him, Answerest thou nothing to those things, that these witness against thee [which these witness against thee]?

63.verse: But Jesus was still. And the prince of priests said to him, I conjure thee by the living God, that thou say to us, if thou art Christ, the Son of God [that thou say to us, if thou be Christ, the Son of God].

64.verse: Jesus said to him, Thou hast said; nevertheless I say to you, hereafter ye shall see man's Son sitting at the right half of the virtue of God [nevertheless, I say to you, from henceforth, ye shall see man's Son sitting at the right half of God's virtue], and coming in the clouds of heaven.

65.verse: Then the prince of priests rent his clothes, and said, He hath blasphemed; what yet have we need to witnesses [Then the prince of priests rent his clothes, saying, He hath blasphemed; what yet need have we to witnesses]? lo! now ye have heard blasphemy;

66.verse: what seemeth to you? And they answered, and said, He is guilty of death.

67.verse: Then they spat in his face, and smote him with buffets; and others gave strokes with the palm of their hands in [into] his face,

68.verse: and said, Thou Christ, declare to us, who is he that smote thee? [saying, Thou Christ, prophesy to us, who is he that smote thee?]

69.verse: And Peter sat without in the hall; and a damsel came to him, and said , [And] Thou were with Jesus of Galilee.

70.verse: And he denied before all [men], and said [saying], I know not what thou sayest.

71.verse: And when he went out at the gate, another damsel saw him , and said to them that were there, And this was with Jesus of Nazareth.

72.verse: And again he denied with an oath, For I knew not the man.

73.verse: And a little after [And after a little], they that stood came, and said to Peter, Truly and thou art [one] of them; for thy speech maketh thee known.

74.verse: Then he began to curse and to swear, that he knew not the man. And at once [And anon] the cock crew.

75.verse: And Peter bethought on the word of Jesus, that he had said, Before the cock crow, thrice thou shalt deny me. And he went out, and wept bitterly.

1.verse: But when the morrowtide was come, all the princes of priests, and the elder men of the people took counsel against Jesus, that they should take him to the death [that they should betake him to death].

2.verse: And they led him bound, and betook him to Pilate of Pontii, [the] justice .

3.verse: Then Judas that betrayed him, saw that he was condemned, he repented, and brought again the thirty pieces [of silver] to the princes of priests, and to the elder men of the people,

4.verse: and said, I have sinned, betraying rightful blood. And they said, What to us? busy thee. [saying, I have sinned, betraying just blood. And they said, What to us? see thou.]

5.verse: And when he had cast forth the [pieces of] silver in the temple, he passed forth, and went, and hanged himself with a snare.

6.verse: And the princes of priests took the [pieces of] silver, and said, It is not leaveful to put it into the treasury [It is not leaveful to send them into the treasury], for it is the price of blood.

7.verse: And when they had taken counsel, they bought with it a field of a potter [they bought with them the field of a potter], into [the] burying of pilgrims.

8.verse: Therefore that field is called Aceldama, that is, a field of blood, into this day.

9.verse: Then that was fulfilled, that was said by the prophet Jeremy [that thing that was said by the prophet Jeremy], saying, And they have taken thirty pieces [of silver], the price of a man praised, whom they praised of the children of Israel;

10.verse: and they gave them into a field of a potter, as the Lord hath ordained to me [as the Lord ordained to me].

11.verse: And Jesus stood before the doomsman; and the justice asked him, and said [and the president asked him, saying], Art thou king of Jews? Jesus saith to him, Thou sayest.

12.verse: And when he was accused of the princes of priests, and of the elder men of the people [and elder men of the people], he answered nothing.

13.verse: Then Pilate saith to him, Hearest thou not, how many things [how many witnessings] they say against thee?

14.verse: And he answered not to him any word, so that the justice wondered greatly [so that the president wondered greatly].

15.verse: But for a solemn day the justice was wont to deliver to the people one bound [Forsooth by a solemn day the president was wont to deliver to the people one bound], whom they would.

16.verse: And he had then a famous man bound [Soothly they had then one famous man bound], that was said Barabbas.

17.verse: Therefore Pilate said to them, when they were [gathered] together, Whom will ye, that I deliver to you [Whom will ye, I let go, or deliver, to you]? whether Barabbas, or Jesus, that is said Christ?

18.verse: For he knew, that by envy they betrayed him. [Soothly he knew, that by envy they betook him.]

19.verse: And while he sat for doomsman [Forsooth him sitting for judge], his wife sent to him, and said [saying], Nothing to thee and to that just man; for I have suffered this day many things for him, by a vision [by a vision, or sweven].

20.verse: Forsooth the princes of priests, and the elder men counseled the people, that they should ask Barabbas, but they should destroy Jesus. [Forsooth the princes of priests and elder men counseled the peoples, that they should ask Barabbas, but Jesus they should lose.]

21.verse: But the justice answered, and said to them, Whom of the twain will ye, that be delivered to you [Forsooth the president answering saith to them, Whom of the two will ye to be let go, or delivered, to you]? And they said, Barabbas.

22.verse: Pilate saith to them, What then shall I do of Jesus, that is said Christ [which is said Christ]? All they say, Be he crucified.

23.verse: The justice saith to them, What evil hath he done? And they cried more, and said, Be he crucified.

24.verse: And Pilate seeing that he profited nothing, but that more [a] noise was made, he took water, and washed his hands before the people, and said, I am guiltless of the blood of this rightful man; busy you .

25.verse: And all the people answered, and said, His blood be on us, and on our children.

26.verse: Then he delivered to them Barabbas, but he took to them Jesus scourged , to be crucified.

27.verse: Then [the] knights of the justice [Then knights of the president] took Jesus in the moot hall, and gathered to him all the company of knights.

28.verse: And they unclothed him, and did about him a red mantle;

29.verse: and they folded a crown of thorns, and put on his head, and a reed in his right hand; and they kneeled before him, and scorned him, and said [and the knee bowed before him, they scorned him, saying], Hail, king of Jews.

30.verse: And they spat on him, and took a reed, and smote his head.

31.verse: And after that they had scorned him, they unclothed him of the mantle, and they clothed him with his clothes, and led him to crucify him [and led him for to be crucified].

32.verse: And as they went out, they found a man of Cyrene coming from the town, Simon by name; they constrained him to take his cross.

33.verse: And they came into a place [And they came to a place] that is called Golgotha, that is, the place of Calvary.

34.verse: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with gall; and when he had tasted, he would not drink.

35.verse: And after that they had crucified him, they parted his clothes, and cast lots, to fulfill that is said by the prophet, saying, They parted to them my clothes, and on my cloak they cast lots. [Soothly after that they had crucified him, they parted his clothes, sending lot, that it should be fulfilled, that is said by the prophet, saying, They parted to them my clothes, and upon my cloth they sent lot.]

36.verse: And they sat, and kept him; [And they sitting kept him;]

37.verse: and set above his head his cause written, This is Jesus of Nazareth, king of Jews [This is Jesus, the king of Jews].

38.verse: Then two thieves were crucified with him, one on the right half, and one on the left half [one on the right half, and another on the left half].

39.verse: And men that passed forth blasphemed him, moving their heads,

40.verse: and saying, Vath to thee [Fie to thee], that destroyest the temple of God, and in the third day buildest it again [and in the third day again buildest it]; save thou thyself; if thou art the Son of God, come down of the cross.

41.verse: Also and [the] princes of priests scorning, with scribes and elder men, said,

42.verse: He made other men safe, he may not make himself safe; if he is [the] king of Israel, come he now down from the cross, and we believe to him;

43.verse: he trusted in God; deliver he him now, if he will; for he said, That I am God's Son [for he said, I am the Son of God].

44.verse: And the thieves, that were crucified with him, upbraided him of the same thing.

45.verse: But from the sixth hour darknesses were made on [upon] all the earth, till the ninth hour.

46.verse: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a great voice, and said [saying], Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani, that is, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

47.verse: And some men that stood there [Soothly some standing there], and hearing, said, This calleth Elias.

48.verse: And at once [And anon] one of them running, took and filled a sponge with vinegar, and put [it] on a reed, and gave to him to drink.

49.verse: But others said, Suffer thou; see we whether Elias come to deliver him.

50.verse: Forsooth Jesus again cried with a great voice, and gave up the ghost. [Forsooth Jesus again crying with a great voice, sent out the spirit.]

51.verse: And lo! the veil of the temple was rent in two parts, from the highest to the lowest. And the earth shook, and the stones were cloven [And the earth was moved, and stones were cleft];

52.verse: and burials were opened, and many bodies of saints that had slept, rose up.

53.verse: And they went out of their burials, and after his resurrection they came into the holy city, and appeared to many.

54.verse: And the centurion and they that were with him keeping Jesus, when they saw the earth-shaking, and those things that were done, they dreaded greatly, and said [saying], Verily this was God's Son.
