55.verse: And there were there many women afar, that followed Jesus from Galilee, and ministered to him. [Forsooth many women were there afar, that followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering to him.]

56.verse: Among which was Mary Magdalene, and Mary, the mother of James, and of Joseph, and the mother of Zebedee's sons.

57.verse: But when the evening was come, there came a rich man of Arimathaea, Joseph by name, and he was a disciple of Jesus [there came a rich man from Arimathaea, Joseph by name, the which and he was disciple of Jesus].

58.verse: He went to Pilate, and asked the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be given [Then Pilate commanded the body to be yielded].

59.verse: And when the body was taken, Joseph wrapped it in a clean sendal, [And the body taken, Joseph wrapped it in a clean sendal, or linen cloth,]

60.verse: and laid it in his new burial, that he had hewn in a stone; and he wallowed a great stone to the door of the burial, and went away.

61.verse: But [Forsooth] Mary Magdalene and another Mary were there, sitting against the sepulchre.

62.verse: And on the tother day, that is after pask even [that is after pask evening], the princes of priests and [the] Pharisees came together to Pilate,

63.verse: and said, Sir, we have mind, that that beguiler said yet living, After three days I shall rise again to life.

64.verse: Therefore command thou, that the sepulchre be kept into the third day; lest his disciples come, and steal him, and say to the people, He hath risen from death; and the last error shall be worse than the former.

65.verse: Pilate said to them, Ye have the keeping; go ye, keep ye as ye know how [go ye, keep ye as ye can].

66.verse: And they went forth, and kept the sepulchre, marking the stone, with [the] keepers. [Forsooth they going forth, kept, or warded, the sepulchre, marking, or sealing, the stone, with keepers.]

1.verse: But in the eventide of the sabbath [Forsooth in the evening of the sabbath, or holiday], that beginneth to shine in the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene came, and another Mary, to see the sepulchre.

2.verse: And lo! there was made a great earth-shaking; for the angel of the Lord came down from heaven, and approached, and turned away the stone , and sat thereon.

3.verse: And his looking was as lightning, and his clothes as snow; [Soothly his looking was as lightning, and his clothes white as snow;]

4.verse: and for dread of him the keepers were afeared, and they were made as dead men.

5.verse: But the angel answered, and said to the women, Do not ye dread, for I know that ye seek Jesus, that was crucified;

6.verse: he is not here, for he is risen, as he said; come ye, and see ye the place [come ye, and see the place], where the Lord was laid.

7.verse: And go ye soon, and say ye to his disciples [And ye going soon, say to his disciples], that he is risen. And lo! he shall go before you into Galilee; there ye shall see him. Lo! I have before-said to you.

8.verse: And they went out soon from the burials [And they went out soon from the sepulchre], with dread and great joy, running to tell to his disciples.

9.verse: And lo! Jesus met them, and said [saying], Hail ye. And they approached , and held his feet, and worshipped him.

10.verse: Then Jesus said to them, Do not ye dread; go ye, tell ye to my brethren, that they go into Galilee; there they shall see me.

11.verse: And when they were gone [And when they had gone], lo! some of the keepers came into the city, and told to the princes of priests all things that were done.

12.verse: And when they were gathered together with the elder men, and had taken their counsel, they gave to the knights much money,

13.verse: and said, Say ye, that his disciples came by night, and have stolen him, while ye slept. [saying, Say ye, for his disciples came by night, and have stolen him, us sleeping.]

14.verse: And if this be heard of the justice [And if this be heard of the president, or justice], we shall counsel him, and make you secure.

15.verse: And when the money was taken, they did, as they were taught. And this word is published among the Jews, till into this day.

16.verse: And the eleven disciples went into Galilee, into an hill, where Jesus had ordained to them [where Jesus had ordained them].

17.verse: And they saw him, and worshipped; but some of them doubted.

18.verse: And Jesus came nigh, and spake to them, and said, All power in heaven and in earth is given to me. [And Jesus coming to, spake to them, saying, All power is given to me, in heaven and in earth.]

19.verse: Therefore go ye, and teach all folks, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost;

20.verse: teaching them to keep all things, whatever things I have commanded to you; and lo! I am with you in all days, into the end of the world.
